results.title: Birth of an island
results.brief_description: Shows the formation of the new volcanic island of Surtsey near Iceland, beginning as a submarine eruption and building up to a substantiasl lava shield of several square miles. Covers the changes in activity of the volcano and investigation by landing parties. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Birth (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Part five of the series, “The Family of Man” which sets out to compare family life in five different locations around the world. In this programme, pregnancy, birth and attitudes of women in all five places are examined, with a side-long look at different superstitions which reveal some strange stories. The programme asks, “Do women in peasant countries give birth with less pain and effort? And if so, why?”

results.title: Birds on a seashore
results.creator_credit: Films Incorporated and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: Shows the various sea birds which live in the world’s largest bird colony on the mainland and offshore islands of Peru and Chile. Records the cries and songs of the birds as they live and propagate in their natural habitat. No narration. Suitable for primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Bird of the thunder woman
results.creator_credit: David Parer and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: An analysis of a wealth exchange cycle in the Papua New Guinea Highlands. Shows part of the Sa cycle of the Wola people of Halalinja, Southern Highlands Province. Cassowaries and pigs, which are highly prized, are raised by the women. At a ceremony lasting two days the birds and pigs are slaughtered by the men and the meat is distributed to relatives and friends. This ceremony is just one in an elaborate cycle of gift exchanges. English commentary, Papua New Guinea dialogue with English subtitles. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: Bird banding in Australia
results.creator_credit: S.T. Evans, CSIRO and Division of Wildlife Research
results.brief_description: Shows how the handling of birds helps biologists to collect information essential for the study and conservation of rare species and the control of pests. Some of the diverse methods banders use for trapping wild birds are shown.

results.title: Biologica (PC)
results.brief_description: This CD-ROM has been designed as a learning and reference tool. The content has beeen selected to fulfil the requirements of most senior high school and introductory university courses in biology. Using the most recent research from universities, it features textual as well as audio and video information to explain concepts and theories, it also includes electron micrographs containing highlighted sections of diagrams, a dictionary of all terms used in the text and hypertext linked information. Includes detail on cell structure, photosynthesis, absorption of nutrients, molecular biology, reproduction, genetics, evolution and more…

results.title: Biography of an atomic vet
results.creator_credit: Nick Mazzuco, Richard Schmiechen, Television Laboratory and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: A personal account of one man’s involvement in the above ground atomic tests that took place in the United States during the 1950’s. Nick Mazzucco recalls the growing awareness of the massive ignorance and indifference of the government in the acceptance of ‘safe radiation levels’.
